isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE (WITH R-12 REFRIGERANT SYSTEM) - DIAGNOSIS AND TESTING

svcproc.title: PROBLEM DIAGNOSIS
svcproc.para: Effective problem diagnosis begins with first determining which of the following problems exists:

item.para: Compressor has excessive vibration or noise

svcproc.para: Diagnostic flow charts are provided; refer to TROUBLESHOOTING,for each of these problem indications. The charts are designed to identify the problem first, then provide corrective steps. These charts begin with the most common and easiest to repair causes, followed by the less common and more difficult causes.
Prior to referring to the "Air Not Cold Enough", Figure 16, chart, perform the PHYSICAL CHECK included below for any conditions indicating a malfunctioning A/C system.

After isolating the cause of the condition, service as indicated in the respective chart. Once the system is free of any of these indicated conditions, the SYSTEM OPERATING CHECK, Figure 12and Figure 13 can be used to determine the overall system condition.
